page.title: 12 Anderson Manor.
page.content: Anderson Manor was built in 1622 by John Tregonwell. In those days it had a farm and stables and many servants. Now my family owns the house and I live in it with my parents and my two brothers. The stables are now a holiday cottage and the farm belongs to somebody else. We own three big fields and have some cattle on them. The gardens are about 80 years old and are surrounded by old walls and yew hedges. There is a Dutch garden with small box hedges and a bowling green and a Ladies walk with roses. We sometimes feed sheep in the orchard. The church is part of the Manor and my brothers and I were christened there. My name is Morwenna Isaac.
